User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
to ensure all servicing workflows that require interactions with Salesforce(B2C) and Envestnet have a defined solution
So that
we can ensure our business processes function as needed in future state
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
We have compiled a list of all current state servicing workflows
When
Reviewed to ensure all required Salesforce (B2C) and Envestnet workflow interactions are accounted for, including:
Invest
Divest
Funding
Withdrawal
Termination
Account Maintenance
Updating Models
Then
We should see those updatesincluded in all future stateworkflows
Human Comments: Break into smaller stories for each workflows (Invest, Divest, Funding etc). Not testable. Accepatance criteria is too vague

User Story:
As a
Key Wealth User
I want
to identify all servicing scenarios that could be improved that are not workflow dependent
So that
we can make our processing more efficient
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
We have identified all servicing scenarios that could be improved,that are not workflow dependent
When
Reviewing future state workflows and an opportunity arises for improvement:
process driven
technical enhancements
Then
We can make updates to workflowsthat reflect these changes
Human Comments:
Decompose into:
1. One story per non-workflow dependent enhancement
2. Add measurable acceptance criteria e.g "Then  processing time for specific  scenario is reduced by X%

User Story:
As a 
KIS FO user
I want 
the KIS client user onboarding workflow to create a new SIS document
So that 
it can be included in the new account enrollment package.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key Investment Services onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
an advisor is onboarding a client/new account
Then
a new SIS (Statement of Investment Selection) document should be created
Note: This is a one-time development story for the creation of the new document for the very first time in the future state.
Human Comments: What if no SIS exists?

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user
I want
the KIS client user onboarding workflow to send an email with consent to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements document
So that
it can encourage clients to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
Key wealth onboarding process workflows are being updated
When
a new account is being onboarded for a KIS client
Then
an email should be sent to clients (as part of campaign trigger) to encourage them for consenting to enroll in e-delivery/paperless statements
Human Comments: Acceptance Criteria : Email content and triggers
Ai Comments:
Explanation: This requirement received a B because it contains all the necessary sections, but the
acceptance criteria are too high-level and lack the specific details needed for implementation. To achieve an
A, the criteria must specify the email's trigger, its content/template, and the exact mechanism for how a client
provides consent.

User Story:

Key wealth leader

the new documents to be included in the enrollment package

the client can sign physically or digitally

Key wealth onboarding processworkflows are being updated
When
the draft account is created inCob 2.0/Net X

Note:
This story is for including SIS in the new account enrollment package

User Story:
As a 
Wealth Leader
I want 
the two-day delay to be made near real-time
So that 
client and account information is available to enroll into online banking and access their accounts
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a client with no online banking access is being onboarded
Or
the client has online banking but needs access to the new account
When
the account is active in Pershing
Then
the relevant client information should be made available for IBX real-time
And
client should be encouraged to enroll into online banking if they haven’t already.
And
have access to the new account in online banking when they enroll.
Human Comments: Acceptance criteria for failure cases. Near real-time as less than 5 mins etc
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement is well-structured with a user story and acceptance criteria that reference specific systems (Pershing, IBX). It earns a B instead of an A because the acceptance criterion 'client should be encouraged to enroll' is ambiguous and needs to specify how this encouragement will be implemented (e.g., via email, a UI prompt).

User Story:
As a
Key wealth leader
I want
the new Key wealth client user onboarding workflow in Salesforce to pre-fill data wherever possible
So that
I do not have to re-keydata.

Given
an advisor/RM is in Salesforce to create a wealth client/opportunity/prospect
When
prior information on the client/opportunity/prospect exists in the wealth instance of Salesforce

the existing data should get auto populated and editable, where applicable.

However, it earns a B because the acceptance criteria are too high-level, using vague phrases like "prior information" and "existing data should get auto populated" without listing the specific fields.

KIS FO user

to ensure that the new KIS client account onboarding workflow is able to autopopulate data where applicable, within RSQ

filling in the RSQ within Salesforce

a previously completed RSQ exists for the same client

appropriate data attributes of the RSQ should be auto populated

in RightBridge for doing Reg BI

onboarding a KIS account

User Story:
As a 
KIS FO user
I want 
to leverage existing RSQ (for a wealth account) on file for a client that has a “Pass” outcome and is less than 29 days old So that 
the account onboarding process can continue without rerunning RSQ for the client

a new KIS account is being onboarded

advisor initiates the proposal creation process

the advisor should be able to skip RSQ if there is an existing RSQ (for a wealth account) on file that has a “Pass” outcome and is less than 29 days old for the client

User Story:
As a
KIS FO user

the KIS account onboarding workflow to make RSQ process through Salesforce mandatory only for a new account being onboarded

an existing KIS account is being modified for adding new product(s)
When
advisor initiates the process of editing such account
Then
the advisor should be able to SSO into RightBridge, opting not to do RSQ for the existing account.

No changes are needed as it is complete and unambiguous for the development team.

the Client Contact Record is kept up to date with changes to a Client’s account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
An Advisor needs to create a financial plan for a Client
When
A financial plan is created
Then
I should see the Client Contact Record in Salesforce updated showing a financial plan was created in MoneyGuide Pro
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement has a clear user story and scope, but the acceptance criteria are too high-level. To reach an 'A', the criteria must specify exactly which fields on the Salesforce Client Contact Record are updated and what their new values or content should be.

User Story:
As a
Key Private Client Advisor
I want
Salesforce to generate a “to-do” follow-up action to meet with client in
'X'
number of days post MARS (ManagedAccount Review) completion,or allow me to manually select a time period for follow-up
So that
I am reminded to meet with the Client post-MARS.
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
I have completed a MARS
When
The Statement of Investment Selection change is completed in Envestnet
Then
I should receive a “to-do” follow-up action reminder in Salesforce X number of days post MARS completion or, if I manually chose a number of days to follow-up, I should receive a “to-do” follow-up action reminder based on that selection
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement includes a user story and acceptance criteria, but contains placeholder language ('X' number of days) for a critical value. To reach Grade A, the default value for 'X' must be defined, and the mechanism for a user to manually select a time period should be specified.

User Story:
As a
Key FO user
I want
the Salesforce Client Contact Record updated if there is a Statement of Investment Selection change event in Envestnet
So that
the Client Contact Record is kept up to date with changes to a Client’s account
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
There is a change to the Statement of Investment Selection
When 
The Statement of Investment Selection change is completed in Envestnet
Then
I should see the Client Contact Record in Salesforce updated showing there was a change to the Statement of Investment Selection
Ai Comments: Explanation: This requirement has a clear user story and scope, but the acceptance criteria are too high-level. To reach Grade A, the 'Then' clause must be more specific about exactly what fields in the Salesforce record are updated and what information they will contain.

User Story:
As a 
Salesforce user
I want 
to ensure that all values that I am seeing on Salesforce, are accurate as of when I am seeing them 
So that 
there is no discrepancy between values in Salesforce and other
systems
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
a value is being loaded from DSC and being displayed in Salesforce
When
that value is being displayed in Salesforce
Then
that value should be accurately displayed with the latest information
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement has the correct structure, but its scope is too broad and undefined, referring to 'all values' in Salesforce. To reach Grade A, it must specify the exact fields, pages, or components to be updated and define 'accurate' with measurable criteria (e.g., data syncs within 5 minutes from system X)

User Story:
As a 
Key Wealth User
I want 
to capture the ASPV 13-05 and 13-12 records for Agent & Communication information 
So that 
we can support the Salesforce and hierarchy file build
Acceptance Criteria:
Given 
Key Bank deals in Annuities
When 
we receive all the Annuities files
Then 
we should capture the ASPV 13-05 and 13-12 records for Agent & Communication information
Human Comments: List specific fields for accuracy
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement has a well-formed user story and an acceptance criteria section is present. However, the acceptance criteria are high-level, merely restating the goal without providing specific, verifiable outcomes. To reach grade A, the AC needs to be expanded with details on how the capture can be verified, such as the target system, specific fields, or success logs.

User Story:
As a 
Salesforce user
I want 
to ensure that all relevant annuities data is being reflected in Salesforce
So that 
I can get an accurate picture of my clients' invested assets
Acceptance Criteria:
Given
all required Annuities data exists in DSC
When
there are any relevant fields in Salesforce that should be considering Annuities data
Then
I would expect Salesforce to consider and reflect Annuities data in all values being presented to the advisor in SF
Human Comments: List specific fields for accuracy
Ai Comments: Explanation: This requirement receives a 'C' because its scope is undefined, as it refers to "all relevant annuities data" and "any relevant fields" without specifics. The acceptance criteria are too high-level and simply restate the goal rather than providing testable conditions. To reach an 'A', the requirement must explicitly list the specific Salesforce fields to be updated and the corresponding source data points from the DSC system.

User Story:
As a 
Front Office User
I want 
the capability to easily send my client relevant CIO/Firm collateral education and enrichment materials
So that 
they can be informed on products and market trends
Acceptance Criteria:

I am a Front Office User
When

Then
I should have the ability to send only information I deem relevant to my Client
Human Comments: Define relevant via filters or selection UI in Acceptance Criteria.
Ai Comments: Explanation: The requirement has a clear user story but fails to provide actionable acceptance criteria, instead just restating the user's goal. To reach grade A, the acceptance criteria must be expanded with specific, testable details about the user flow, and the scope needs to be defined by referencing the specific pages or components involved.
